paragraphs.title: Clone the repo from git
paragraphs.text:
%sh

cd /var/
sudo git clone https://github.com/databricks/tpcds-kit.git

paragraphs.title: Make the tpcds tool kit
paragraphs.text:
%sh

cd /var/tpcds-kit/tools
sudo make OS=LINUX

paragraphs.text:
%md

### Using the tpcds tool kit

#### Data generation
Data generation is done via dsdgen. See dsdgen --help for all options. If you do not run dsdgen from the tools/ directory then you will need to use the option -DISTRIBUTIONS /.../tpcds-kit/tools/tpcds.idx.

~~~
dsdgen \
-DIR =  <s>               -- generate tables in directory <s>
-HELP =  <n>              -- display this message
-PARAMS =  <s>            -- read parameters from file <s>
-QUIET =  [Y|N]           -- disable all output to stdout/stderr
-SCALE =  <n>             -- volume of data to generate in GB
-TABLE =  <s>             -- build only table <s>
-UPDATE =  <n>            -- generate update data set <n>
-VERBOSE =  [Y|N]         -- enable verbose output
-PARALLEL =  <n>          -- build data in <n> separate chunks
-CHILD =  <n>             -- generate <n>th chunk of the parallelized data
-VALIDATE =  [Y|N]        -- produce rows for data validation
~~~

####Query generation
Query generation is done via dsqgen. See dsqgen --help for all options.

The following command can be used to generate all 99 queries in numerical order (-QUALIFY) for the 10TB scale factor (-SCALE) using the Netezza dialect template (-DIALECT) with the output going to /tmp/query_0.sql (-OUTPUT_DIR).

~~~
dsqgen \
-DIRECTORY ../query_templates \
-INPUT ../query_templates/templates.lst \
-VERBOSE Y \
-QUALIFY Y \
-SCALE 10000 \
-DIALECT netezza \
-OUTPUT_DIR /tmp
-DELIMITER=
~~~

msg.data:
Using the tpcds tool kit

Data generation

Data generation is done via dsdgen. See dsdgen –help for all options. If you do not run dsdgen from the tools/ directory then you will need to use the option -DISTRIBUTIONS /…/tpcds-kit/tools/tpcds.idx.

dsdgen \
-DIR =  <s>               -- generate tables in directory <s>
-HELP =  <n>              -- display this message
-PARAMS =  <s>            -- read parameters from file <s>
-QUIET =  [Y|N]           -- disable all output to stdout/stderr
-SCALE =  <n>             -- volume of data to generate in GB
-TABLE =  <s>             -- build only table <s>
-UPDATE =  <n>            -- generate update data set <n>
-VERBOSE =  [Y|N]         -- enable verbose output
-PARALLEL =  <n>          -- build data in <n> separate chunks
-CHILD =  <n>             -- generate <n>th chunk of the parallelized data
-VALIDATE =  [Y|N]        -- produce rows for data validation

Query generation

Query generation is done via dsqgen. See dsqgen –help for all options.

The following command can be used to generate all 99 queries in numerical order (-QUALIFY) for the 10TB scale factor (-SCALE) using the Netezza dialect template (-DIALECT) with the output going to /tmp/query_0.sql (-OUTPUT_DIR).

dsqgen \
-DIRECTORY ../query_templates \
-INPUT ../query_templates/templates.lst \
-VERBOSE Y \
-QUALIFY Y \
-SCALE 10000 \
-DIALECT netezza \
-OUTPUT_DIR /tmp
-DELIMITER=

# Setup

rm -rf  /tmp/cloudmart
mkdir -p  /tmp/cloudmart

paragraphs.title: 2 - Generate data, -SCALE is in Gbytes

cd /var/tpcds-kit/tools
./dsdgen -SCALE 1 -DIR /tmp/cloudmart

paragraphs.title: Additional resources
paragraphs.text:
%md
We hope you've enjoyed this lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

1. [Cloudera Tutorials](http://cloudera.com/tutorials.html) are your natural next step where you can explore Spark in more depth.
2. [Cloudera Community](https://community.cloudera.com) is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
3. [Apache Spark Documentation](https://spark.apache.org/documentation.html) - official Spark documentation.
4. [Apache Zeppelin Project Home Page](https://zeppelin.apache.org) - official Zeppelin web site.
